info.title: Sage Accounting API - Contacts
info.description: Documentation of the Sage Business Cloud Accounting API.

contact.name: Sage Business Cloud Accounting API Team

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description:
Addresses can be associated with Contacts and with Bank Accounts, either as Main Addresses or Delivery Addresses. When you create an Address, you will need to specify an associated contact via its ID. When creating a Contact, however, you can specify address data and the address is automatically created in the background. Thus, it makes sense create addresses only for existing contacts to save requests.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Address Types
tags.description:
An Address Type is used to categorize Addresses, such as Accounts, Sales, Delivery etc. This is a subresource to the Addresses resource and referenced in the Addresses endpoint as an association.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Address Regions
tags.description:
Address Regions are used to handle region specific tax rates and are referenced in several resources across the Accounting API. They represent a State in the USA or a Province in Canada. This endpoint is immutable and only here for your convenience, i.e. to be used in (drop-down) lists etc.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description:
Contacts in Sage Business Cloud Accounting represent the companies a user of Sage Accounting does business with. They can be either customers or suppliers/vendors. For most transactions in Accounting, Contacts are involved: Invoicing, Payments, Banking, â€¦ Do not confuse Contacts with Contact Persons, who represent the staff of a company.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Contact Types
tags.description:
This endpoint represents the different types that contacts can be stored as e.g. Customer or Supplier/Vendor. This is a subresource to the Contact resource and referenced in the Contact endpoint as an association. Since the contact type is compulsory when creating a Contact, you can use this endpoint to get their IDs (for use as association) as well as a human readable label.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Contact People
tags.description:
A Contact Person represents a person in the staff of a company the user does business with. You can think of a Contact Person as of a staff member who works at one of the company's addresses (subsidiaries). Thus, the associations are as follows: a company (endpoint "Contact") has at least one address (endpoint "Address"), which again has at least one contact person (endpoint "Contact Persons").

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Contact Person Types
tags.description:
A Contact Person Type is used to categorize Contact Persons, such as Accounts, Sales, Purchasing etc. This is a subresource to the Contact Person resource and referenced in the Contact Person endpoint as an association. Since the contact person type is compulsory when creating a Contact Person, you can use this endpoint to get their IDs (for use as association) as well as a human readable label.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Countries
tags.description:
This endpoint represents the countries as they are stored in Sage Business Cloud Accounting. This is a subresource to the Address resource and referenced in the Address endpoint as an association. Since the country is compulsory when creating an Address, you can use this endpoint to get their IDs (for use as association) as well as a human readable label.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

tags.name: Country Groups
tags.description:
The Country Group categorizes Country resources. Possible values are ALL, CA, EU, GBIE and US.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Contact and Address relationships

get.description:
### Endpoint Availability

* Accounting Plus: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª
* Accounting Standard: ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª
* Accounting Start: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

### Access Control Restrictions

Requires the authenticated user to have any mentioned role in one of the listed areas:
* Area: `Contacts`: Read Only, Restricted Access, Full Access
* Area: `Sales`: Read Only, Restricted Access, Full Access
* Area: `Purchases`: Read Only, Restricted Access, Full Access

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by contact id

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by bank account id

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Addresses changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: deleted_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Addresses deleted since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Not inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Addresses per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Addresses

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Addresses (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Contacts changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: deleted_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Contacts deleted since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Not inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: contact_type_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by contact type id

parameters.name: exclude_system
parameters.description: Use this to filter out system entities, not applicable for transaction creation

parameters.name: nested_attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for nested entities of the Contacts (expose all nested attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: show_balance
parameters.description: Use this to display the balance for a contact.

parameters.name: context_date
parameters.description: Use this to determine the correct tax treatment for a contact on a given date.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Use this to filter by the contact name, company name or reference.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Use this to filter by the contact person email address.

parameters.name: filter_inactive_contacts
parameters.description: Use this to filter inactive contacts

parameters.name: filter_foreign_currencies
parameters.description: Use this to filter for base currency contacts only.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Contacts per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Contacts

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Contacts (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Country Group Key.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Country Group (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

bank_account.description: The related bank account of the address, if the address belongs to a bank account.

contact.description: The related contact of the address, if the address belongs to a contact.

address_type.description:
Defines the nature of the address (Shipping, Billing, Head Office etc.).
Start defaults to "Sales" for Customers and "Purchasing" for Vendors

name.description: The custom name of the address

country_group.description:
Country group allows countries to be filtered for selection.
Set it to e.g. EU if the address is within the EEC.

is_main_address.description: Specifies the address as the contact's main address. Only a single address can exist for a contact in Start so this is always true when returned by the API but cannot be seen in the UI

address_type_id.description:
Defines the nature of the address (Shipping, Billing, Head Office etc.).
Start defaults to "Sales" for Customers and "Purchasing" for Vendors

name.description: The custom name of the address

is_main_address.description: Specifies the address as the contact's main address. Only a single address can exist for a contact in Start so this is always true when returned by the API but cannot be seen in the UI

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address

bank_account_id.description: The related bank account of the address, if the address belongs to a bank account.

contact_id.description: The related contact of the address, if the address belongs to a contact.

country_group_id.description: The ID of the Country Group.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

contact_types.description: The type of the contact. It has to be either CUSTOMER or VENDOR

name.description: The contact's full name or business name

default_sales_ledger_account.description:
The default sales ledger account for the contact
Customers only

default_sales_tax_rate.description:
The default sales tax rate for the contact
Customers only

default_purchase_ledger_account.description:
The default purchase ledger account for the contact
Vendors only

tax_number.description: The VAT registration number of the contact. The format will be validated.

main_address.description: The main address associated with the contact

main_contact_person.description: The main contact person of the contact.

bank_account_details.description: The account details for the contact's bank account

credit_limit.description:
Custom credit limit amount for the contact
not applicable to Start

credit_days.description:
Custom credit days for the contact.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings and use 'customer_credit_days'/'vendor_credit_days' as default/fallback according to your use case.

credit_terms.description:
Credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice, month_end_payment,
date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings
and use 'customer_credit_terms'/'vendor_credit_terms' as default.

credit_terms_and_conditions.description:
Custom terms and conditions for the contact. If set will override global /invoice_settings default terms and conditions.
Customers only

product_sales_price_type.description:
All default product_sales_price_type defaults. Learn more about sales price types
Customers only, not applicable to Start

source_guid.description: Used when importing contacts from external sources

currency.description:
The currency that the contact trades in
not applicable to Start

aux_reference.description:
Auxiliary reference. Used for German "Kreditorennummer" and "Debitorennummer".
See Datev Settings endpoint reference

registered_number.description: The registered number of the contact's business. Only used for German businesses and represents the "Steuernummer" there (not the "USt-ID").

deletable.description: Indicates whether the contact can be deleted successfully

tax_treatment.description: The tax treatment - indicates which tax rules to apply for a contact

email.description: The email address for the given contact

tax_calculation.description:
France: The tax calculation method used to define tax treatment Vendors only
Spain: Defines if contact is a retailer and tax is subject to Recargo de Equivalencia Customers only United Kingdom: Defines if contact tax treatment is domestic reverse charge Customers & Suppliers

auxiliary_account.description:
Auxiliary account - used when auxiliary accounting is enabled in business settings.
Available only in Spain and France

gdpr_obfuscated.description: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. It introduces new rules for how business owners manage their contacts' personal data. When this field returns 'true', means that the contact has been requested to be obfuscated and you can not create any artifact (sales invoices, purchase invoices, ...) but you can still check previously created artifacts.

system.description: Identifies a contact as being a system contact used for processing specific transaction types and reserved specifically for those transaction types such as tax return payments/refunds.

has_unfinished_recurring_invoices.description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with any unfinished recurring invoices

cis_registered.description:
Identifies a contact as being registered as CIS.
only applicable to UK business

ni_based.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Northern Ireland.

is_active.description: Identifies a contact as being active

gb_based.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Great Britain.

cis_settings.description: The CIS Settings for the contact

destination_vat_blocking.description: Identifies a contact should be blocked due to destination vat

Contact.description:

* Accounting Plus: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

### Access Control Restrictions

Requires the authenticated user to have any mentioned role in one of the listed areas:
* Area: `Contacts`: Restricted Access, Full Access

rel.description: The relationship of the link to the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

ledger_account_group.description: The ledger account group for the account

name.description:
The name for the ledger account.

Changes to this field do not propagate to other resources, namely not to the name of the associated
bank_account (unlike the behaviour of the UI).

display_name.description: The display name for the ledger account

visible_scopes.description:
The visible scopes for the ledger account.

This indicates in which of the UI's areas the ledger account is displayed and available for user
selection. Possible entries in this array are `bank`, `sales`, `purchasing`, `other_payment`,
`other_receipt`, `reporting`, `journals`, `sales_eu`, `sales_row`, `purchasing_eu`, `purchasing_row`
and `purchasing_hrc`.

included_in_chart.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is included in the chart of accounts

nominal_code.description: The nominal code of the ledger account

ledger_account_type.description: The ledger account type for the ledger account

ledger_account_classification.description: The ledger account classification for the ledger account

tax_rate.description: The default tax rate for the ledger account

fixed_tax_rate.description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

visible_in_banking.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the banking area of the application

visible_in_expenses.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the purchases area of the application

visible_in_journals.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the journals area of the application

visible_in_other_payments.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other payments area of the application

visible_in_other_receipts.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other receipts area of the application

visible_in_reporting.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the reporting area of the application

visible_in_sales.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the sales area of the application

balance_details.description: The ledger account balance details for the date range provided

is_control_account.description:
Indicates whether the ledger account is a control account.

Control accounts cannot be removed. See also `control_name`.

control_name.description:
The control name for the ledger account.

This is used internally by Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes etc.
You cannot add ledger accounts with control name and you cannot modify the control name of existing
ledger accounts.

display_formatted.description: The display name formatted based on coa_list_order in settings

tax_recoverable.description: Indicates that transactions posted to this ledger account have part recoverable taxes (Canada only)

recoverable_percentage.description: The partial recoverable tax rate (Canada only)

cis_materials.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Materials

tax_instalment.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for Tax Intalment (Canada only)

cis_labour.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Labour

gifi_code.description:
The GIFI code of the ledger account.

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

credit_or_debit.description: Is the balance a debit or credit

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

contact_person_types.description: The contact person types for the contact person. Get possible types by retrieving all available contact person types .

name.description: The name of the contact person

job_title.description: The job title of the contact person

telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact person

mobile.description: The mobile number of the contact person

email.description: The email address of the contact person

fax.description: The fax number of the contact person

is_main_contact.description: Indicates whether this is the main contact person. Per contact, only one main contact can be selected.

address.description: The address of the contact person

is_preferred_contact.description: Indicates whether this contact person is a preferred contact
